title: (x) 'Glen Landing Wrestling': angular slab / Sports Block Font--But Which One? - probably custom {Andreas H}
content:
Can anyone identify this font. It looks close to many things, but the unique G and W are throwing me off. I'm trying to replicate this type face for a project.  
Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [PC080458.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202114548/http:/typophile.com/files/PC080458.JPG) | 143.38 KB |
author: jenmcg22

comments.content:
It does not look like digital type. If it were you would need two different fonts for the different widths.  
You could start with [http://www.dafont.com/staubach.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=GLEN+WANDIN](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202114548/http:/www.dafont.com/staubach.font?nb_ppp=50&text=GLEN+WANDIN "http://www.dafont.com/staubach.font?nb\_ppp=50&text=GLEN+WANDIN") or looke here [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=104&nb\_ppp=50](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202114548/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=104&nb_ppp=50 "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=104&nb\_ppp=50") to look at alternatives.

The very reason of existence for this kind of lettering was that it could be easily cut out so you didn't need a computer ;-) AFAIK only US teams still use that awkward kind of lettering. European sports teams prefer more recent type on their tee shirts.
Thanks so much. I've also started to think that these were cut-out or stenciled letters, so it helped that you confirmed this suspicion.
